comments.text:
Work: Mac/pc
Editing: both
Gaming: PC
OS simplicity: PC
Mouse and Keyboard: PC
Price: PC, a 1200€ mac laptop has shit parts when you can build a pc for 
900€ and get miles better performance.
Design: Mac
I've used them both and noticed that apple products are more fashion 
products. People just want the social status.
Now, the macs are good for editing is bs. They are, but it is not like pc's 
suck at it...
1200€ is ridiculously overpriced for a LAPTOP!! 
The macbooks are fun to take with you and use to do browsing and other cool 
stuff. It is just that there are laptops well below 600€ that do the same 
thing. Apple fanboys pls.﻿

comments.author: Kieran Borovac

comments.text:
Windows better for 1 reason, and 1 reason only (all else is opinion and 
half truths):
A single company doesn't have control over all the product. AKA there is 
competition. AKA the price isn't spiked up higher than it reasonably should 
be.

Some say this leads to a loss of quality. Sure, somewhat, but if you buy 
smart, the quality is basically the same.

Also, just going to throw it out there, but Mac has viruses and the like 
too. Hell, there was a single virus (nVir) that was able to infect 
Macintosh computers for ~13 years of updates (the OS version number 
literally doubled) with no changes to coding and, iirc, only stopped being 
able to spread because Apple changed how they handled hard drive data, not 
because they fixed the vulnerabilities.﻿

comments.author: Kevin Alonso

comments.text:
Really there's no debat about this, a Mac can do things a Pc can't, and a 
Pc can do what a Mac doesn't. There's no facts when you say which one is 
better because it is really an opinion. Sure, I love to use my mac, but I 
have to use my pc because my Mac broke. I use macs for gaming because I 
know I can rely on it to handle the game, the only reason why Windows Pc is 
mostly use for gaming is because all the developers are too lazy to be a 
real developer and make it compatible with Mac. If all the game developers 
had done their games on a Mac before a Pc, you'd be saying that Mac was 
gaming and Pc was work. So really, no matter how you put it, there's really 
no greater.﻿

comments.author: james thomas

comments.text:
Alright, here's the thing. 
Macs are good for working, like word processing and watching YouTube. It 
can be alright for gaming but they do crash every now and then. As because 
they are mostly all in one types, you can really make it better unless you 
sell it. They are over priced for what they can do.
PCs are good for gaming, word processing, rendering videos, recording 
videos, pretty much everything. They are not over priced, I have a Acer 
Aspire XC - 603, it's not failed me one bit. You can upgrade them, you can 
just unscrew the case and install some more RAM or another thing you want 
in it with no hassle. From a 4GB pc you can make it 8GB for no more than 
£50. You can get good quality ones for around £200-300. You can get gaming 
ones for only like £250. Macs are over £1000 and all that shit. A kid can 
buy a PC within a few weeks/months. 

This isn't hate. Macs can be good, just depending what you use them for. ﻿
